required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Atrophic Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD) Treated With Intravitreal Injections of Umbilical Cord Blood Platelet-rich Plasma (CB-PRP): a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Atrophic Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD) Treated With Intravitreal Injections of Umbilical Cord Blood Platelet-rich Plasma (CB-PRP): a Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study will be to evaluate the efficacy of intravitreal injections of Umbilical Cord Blood Platelet-rich Plasma (CB-PRP) in order to reduce or stabilize the atrophic progression in dry Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomization will take place by eye, each patient will have one eye treated and the contralateral subjected to sham. The treated eye will receive CB-PRP injections modulated differently over time in each of the sub-studies, i.e. monthly, bimonthly or quarterly, while the contralateral eye will receive a SHAM injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Autofluorescence atrophy area changes in treated eyes compared with sham group
primary_outcome.description: Stabilization of enlargement of hypoautofluorescent area (atrophy) or at most a maximum increase of no more than 20% compared with baseline in treated subjects compared with placebo group from baseline until follow-ups

primary_outcome.measure: Autofluorescence atrophy area changes in treated eyes compared with sham group (1)
primary_outcome.description: Stabilization of the enlargement of the hyperfluorescent area (atrophy enhancement) or at most a maximum increase of not more than 20% from the baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Increase of at least two lines from baseline measurement and/or to the contralateral untreated eye at 3 and 6, 12, months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean increase in ONL thickness and retinal volumetrics
secondary_outcome.description: Mean increase, measured by high-resolution quantitative OCT, of at least 20% from baseline at 3 and 6, 12, months
Mean increase, measured by high-resolution quantitative OCT, of at least 20% from baseline at 3 and 6, 12, months

secondary_outcome.measure: Stabilization of the atrophy region of the EPR
secondary_outcome.description: Stabilization in enface OCT with less than 20% increase from baseline, comparing it with the placebo group, at 3 and 6, 12, months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incomplete retinal pigment epithelial (RPE) and outer retinal atrophy (iRORA)

other_outcome.description: Evaluation of major ocular adverse events (bacterial or fungal septic endophthalmitis, retinal detachment, vitreous proliferative-fibrotic reaction with retinal traction, secondary glaucoma, phthisis bulbs, iris rubeosis), studied at slit-lamp evaluation in the anterior and posterior chambers.

arm_group.description: The patients will recive 12 intravitreal injections in one eye and 12 sham injections in the other eye each month
The patients will receive 6 intravitreal injections in one eye and 6 sham injections in the other eye each two months
The patients will receive 4 intravitreal injections in one eye and 4 sham injections in the other eye each three months

intervention.description: The procedure consists in a trans-scleral puncture to access the vitreous cavity, with subsequent injection of CB-PRP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥65 years
- Bilateral dry-AMD
- ETDRS-corrected visual acuity between (or equal to) 1/10 and 4/10
- No concomitant ocular pathology (e.g., Glaucoma, amblyopia) or systemic pathology that would result in a BIAS for primary goal assessment
- Signature of informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 65 years
- Pregnancy
- Previous inflammatory/infectious events involving the eyes
- Eye trauma, diabetes, or disease potentially damaging to the visual system, even in the absence of impairment at the time of intake
- Previous intravitreal treatments.
- Refusal to sign informed consent.

facility.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
